{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3290314,"name":"Brennan","username":"BMcT_Official","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmct_official/{size}/211427_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-20T23:51:01.872Z","cooked":"

Hello,

Our team is trying to use the NavX as a gyro for our bot but I’m having issues figuring out how to get it to fit with the StatusSignal class.

NavX.getYaw() returns the yaw reading as a float. StatusSignal does not seem to understand how to convert a Float to a Double.

public final AHRS gyro = new AHRS(SerialPort.Port.kMXP);
private final StatusSignal<Double> yaw = gyro.getYaw();

Has anyone been successful doing this? Does Phoenix6 not support NavX?

Could you cast it?

Phoenix does not support NavX as it is not a CTRE device.

Understood thank you.

Is it possible to use NavX with AdvantageKit then? If so is there an example of this somewhere?

I understand that AdvantageKit is not tied to a vendor, but I’m having trouble finding an example of creating a “custom” IO source

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-01-21T00:13:28.503Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":67,"readers_count":66,"score":38.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":451304,"topic_slug":"using-navx-with-statussignal","display_username":"Brennan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":45487,"username":"DeltaDizzy","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/deltadizzy/{size}/170886_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63437,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"SPIKE 293 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/using-navx-with-statussignal/451304/4","custom_user_title":"SPIKE 293 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3290440,"name":"","username":"DeltaDizzy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/deltadizzy/{size}/170886_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-21T02:53:42.949Z","cooked":"

The AdvantageKit example projects show creation of custom IO interfaces/classes, and the input seems to be the gyro reading moreso than the gyro itself, so replacing the Pigeon with a NavX seems like it’d be pretty straightforward (looking mostly at the diff_drive example project).
